U.S. Forces Urged to Withdraw from S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Forces Urged to Withdraw from S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Alejandro Cao De Benos, chairman of the Association for Friendship with the Korean People which has its branches in at least 90 countries, issued a statement titled "The U.S. should withdraw its aggression troops and lethal weapons from south Korea at once" on August 29, 60 years after the U.S. forces' occupation of south Korea.
 The 60-year history of the U.S. military occupation of south Korea is a history of disasters which arrested the genuine socio-political development of south Korea and brought all misfortunes and sufferings to the south Korean people and a history of crimes which blocked the unified development of the Korean nation and gravely threatened peace and security on the Korean Peninsula, the statement said, and went on:    
 We extend firm support and solidarity to the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front and the south Korean people in their struggle for independence against the U.S. and for national reunification and strongly demand once again that the U.S. withdraw all its aggression forces and war hardware from south Korea without delay.

Reception Given for Former Unconverted Long-term Prisoners
articles.content:
Reception Given for Former Unconverted Long-term Prisoners 
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- A reception was given at the People's Palace of Culture on the occasion of the fifth anniversary of the repatriation of unconverted long-term prisoners, pro-reunification patriotic fighters, to the socialist homeland.
 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Wan Su, director of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of the Fatherland, An Kyong Ho, director of the Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, officials concerned, former unconverted long-term prisoners and their families.    
 Speaking at the reception, Kim Ki Nam said that leader  Kim Jong Il has put forward the former unconverted long-term prisoners as men of strong faith and will and constantly bestowed warm comradely love and benevolence on them.
 The speaker expressed the belief that all the former unconverted long-term prisoners will remain loyal to the idea and leadership of Kim Jong Il and their families and posterity will dynamically fight along the road of Songun revolution. 
 Former unconverted long-term prisoner Hong Kyong Son, speaking next, extended warmest thanks carrying the unanimous mind of the former unconverted long-term prisoners to Kim Jong Il for bestowing the highest titles of heroes of the Republic and winners of National Reunification Prize upon them who would have withered from scores of years of severe torture at prison and for making them enjoy a worthy life as the pro-reunification patriotic fighters known to the whole country, the whole nation and the whole world.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. Struggle Called for
End to Colonial History Called for
articles.content:
End to Colonial History Called for 
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification reportedly issued a statement on August 30 as regards the opening to the public of the list of pro-Japanese elements. The statement stressed that the organization hails the publication of the list and will take the lead in the struggle to remove the pro-Japanese, pro-U.S. sycophantic forces.
 The statement charged that the pro-American sycophantic forces including the Grand National Party are slandering the publication of the list and scheming to lay obstacles in the way of liquidating the past history.    
 History cannot be put on a correct track unless the past stained with pro-Japanese acts is clearly liquidated, the statement said, stressing that the colonial history disgraced by the United States following the Japanese imperialists should be redressed at an early date.

Togolese PM on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Togolese PM on Relations with DPRK
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- I have very good feelings of friendship with the Korean people and I am ready to strive for development of bilateral ties.
 Edem Kodjo, Togolese prime minister, said this, when meeting with Kim Pyong Gi, DPRK ambassador, who paid a courtesy call on him on Aug. 25. 
 Much effort was made for Korea's reunification, but no fruition was made because the outsiders did not want the Korean nation in the north and south to get united to reunify the country, he said, hoping that the DPRK government would achieve a fresh success in its effort for the reunification of the country.

Stop to Cooperation with U.S. in War Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Cooperation with U.S. in War Demanded in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The June 15 Solidarity of Youth and Students of south Korea reportedly issued a statement titled "The authorities, stop at once cooperation with the U.S. in war" on August 30.
 Recalling that the south Korean authorities have recently decided to go ahead with the procedures to convert the CONPLAN 5029 into an OPLAN, the statement said that this is intolerable as it is an act of deterring the north-south relations from favorably developing and bringing the danger of war to the Korean Peninsula once again.
 The authorities agreed with the U.S. proposal to hold war confabs against the north, thus finding themselves in a position where they have no option but to get involved in the U.S. operation for a preemptive attack on the north any time, the statement noted.
 Cooperation with foreign forces and national cooperation can never go together, it said, noting that if the authorities truly respect the June 15 joint declaration and want reconciliation, cooperation, peace and reunification, they should behave with reason.
 They should stop at once the disgraceful acts of following the U.S. moves for a war against the north and take the road of national independence, peace against war and reunification and patriotism, it stressed.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Late Ra Sun Yong
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Late Ra Sun Yong
    Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of the late Pro. and Dr. Ra Sun Yong, 85, researcher of the Academy of Medical Science who is merited scientist and candidate academician, on Saturday to express deep condolences over his demise.
 He came over to the north from south Korea during the period of the Fatherland Liberation War. He distinguished himself in devoting all his wisdom and energies to scientific research for preventing and eradicating parasitosis and to the education of posterity in the northern half of Korea in response to the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea on public health and its line of preventive medicine, while working at educational and scientific research institutions for a long time.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to U.S.A. Red Cross
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to U.S.A. Red Cross
    Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Red Cross Society Saturday sent a message of sympathy to the U.S.A. Red Cross as regards Hurricane Katrina that hit the southern areas of the United States recently, causing disastrous damage.
 In the message the society expressed sympathy with the U.S.A. Red Cross in connection with the great disaster suffered by those areas due to the hurricane and hoped that they would recover from it and the living of the inhabitants in the afflicted areas return to normal as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation of Lawyers Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation of Lawyers Leaves for China
    Pyongyang, September 3 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation of lawyers led by Kim Pyong Ryul, chief justice of the Central Court of the DPRK, left here today to participate in the 22nd World Conference of Lawyers to be held in China.
 The delegation was seen off at the Pyongyang Railway Station by Yun Myong Guk, first deputy chief justice of the Central Court, and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
